what: A R-Package to interact with the Pavlovia.Org-Platform
title: Interact with Pavlovia.Org from within R

previous_headings: A R-Package to interact with the Pavlovia.Org-Platform
title: Interact with Pavlovia.Org from within R
text: early version package, install GitHub repository. First install remotes package. install pavloviaR using install_github function remotes.

previous_headings: A R-Package to interact with the Pavlovia.Org-Platform
title: Interact with Pavlovia.Org from within R
code: library(pavloviaR) tokenObject <- getAccessTokenByUsernameAndPassword("Username","Password") token<- tokenObject$data$token  projects <- getProjectList(token)  dataList <- getTibbleOfDataDirectoryOfProject(token,150783)   mergedData <- mergeDataTibble(dataList$data)

what: Creates an API-Access-Token on Gitlab.Pavlovia.Org by using username/password. — getAccessTokenByUsernameAndPassword
title: Creates an API-Access-Token on Gitlab.Pavlovia.Org by using username/password. — getAccessTokenByUsernameAndPassword
text: Tokens named PavloviaR_#Random_String#. Tokens saved accessToken.csv current working directory reused. avoid creating unlimited number accessTokens gitlab.pavlovia.org. careful token!

title: Creates an API-Access-Token on Gitlab.Pavlovia.Org by using username/password. — getAccessTokenByUsernameAndPassword

text: username Username Email registered account Pavlovia password Passord Pavlovia/Gitlab.Pavlovia Account

title: Creates an API-Access-Token on Gitlab.Pavlovia.Org by using username/password. — getAccessTokenByUsernameAndPassword
text: Response object $data (Names list: $name-> Name Token , $token -> AccessToken) $message status message $isError (True API Call unsuccessful)

title: Creates an API-Access-Token on Gitlab.Pavlovia.Org by using username/password. — getAccessTokenByUsernameAndPassword
code: tokenResponseObject <- getAccessTokenByUsernameAndPassword("username", "12345") tokenResponseObject$data$token #here is your accessToken #> NULL

title: Get a tibble of the data-files in the /data/-Directory of the repository. — getTibbleOfDataDirectoryOfProject

title: Get a tibble of the data-files in the /data/-Directory of the repository. — getTibbleOfDataDirectoryOfProject
code: tibbleOfDataFiles <- getTibbleOfDataDirectoryOfProject("#######",12345) #> Warning: cannot open file 'accessToken': No such file or directory #> Error in file(con, "r"): cannot open the connection
